posts.post_content: Oddly enough, modern Magic's successor to this is [Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime), which is a more creature-oriented means of removing things than old spells like this or [Creeping Mold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Creeping Mold). Interestingly, this ancient spell from the game's infancy also kills planeswalkers.

Posted By: Lord_Ascapelion (11/15/2012 12:32:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At first, it seems kind of underwhelming.   
6 CMC to destroy any permanent? That's a little... I dunno, costly!  
  
However, it hit me while constructing a mono-green EDH deck: Green has no creature removal!  
  
Sure, there's [Hurricane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurricane) and [Whirlwind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whirlwind), and you could play [Brittle Effigy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brittle Effigy), but the first two only target flyers, and the second only targets 1 creature!   
  
So, either you have to play [Lure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lure) on a deathtouch creature or [Predatory Rampage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Predatory Rampage), or this. Therefore, I think this should be given a chance.   
  
However, if it were in any other colour (even Blue), it'd not be 1/10th as highly rated.
posts.html:
At first, it seems kind of underwhelming.
6 CMC to destroy any permanent? That's a little... I dunno, costly!

However, it hit me while constructing a mono-green EDH deck: Green has no creature removal!

Sure, there's Hurricane and Whirlwind, and you could play Brittle Effigy, but the first two only target flyers, and the second only targets 1 creature!

So, either you have to play Lure on a deathtouch creature or Predatory Rampage, or this. Therefore, I think this should be given a chance.

However, if it were in any other colour (even Blue), it'd not be 1/10th as highly rated.
